betterquesting:10.desc:8:
These are suggestions to make this pack a little more managable, and to progress at the fastest rate.

1. Play on Peacful mode, mob loot is not needed to progress

2. Play this pack on a superflat default world type, this will follow perfectly towards progression

3. This is a tutorial series(Kinda) on Gregtech Community Editon Unnofficial, this is not my mod and this pack was built off of their community pack. §6§§This pack is made for pure §fprogression towards gregtech and having fun while doing so. Also thier may be some foul langauge every now and again since I get mad. Sorry...

4. This pack has no required exploration or mining, all resources will be able to be collected skyblock style.

5. Have fun!! If you don't than I will refuse to give you any questbook rewards.

I really have nothing else to say after I made the two other pointer quests, but I wanted the quest book to look nice so I made one more quest here. Ya that's it

U know what? Fine, since I don't want to completley ruin this quest area I will add a few more pointers to this pack I guess...

Early game will be different from other packs so their is that, and also the world needs to be superflat for the best experience towards progression, idk if i mentioned that or not.

Thats all, now have a stupid cookie for reading all of this.

While it is eaiser to gather ores this way, thier will also be even more advanced ways of getting quantanties of ores. 

Make sure to check jei for these recipes as they are completly hand crafted by yours truly.

To get more §8iron §fu will need to surround a piece of double comp cobble with 8 iron ore pieces. This will yield 32x the ore.

To get more §6copper §fu will need to surround a piece of double comp cobble with 4 iron ore chunks and 4 pieces of flint. This will yield 32x the ore

To get more §7tin §fu will need to surround a piece of double comp cobble with 4 iron ore chunks and 4 pieces of flint(In different shape). This will yield 32x the ore

You want more ore pieces? So needy.

Alr I will let u in on a little secret. If you combine your flint meshes with an ingot of iron the mesh will get strong enough to sieve at the iron level.

Oh and diamonds, those can be made by transmuting an iron ingot with 1 gold ore chunk.

More on diamonds later

§TThis will yield the greatest §cRatio§c §fof all §cRatios§f for iron ore piece generation and gold ore pieces as well. 

With the diamond mesh u are able to obtain ores relativly quickly so that is a plus.

Eventually you will have an extremly effecient way of collecting ores, but that is gated towards progession of the pack, so keep an eye out for that quest later on
betterquesting:10.name:8: The best of the best ratios

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
To collect flint in a more effecient manner you can craft up a mortar that will drop flint at a 1 gravel to 1 flint §cRatio §fwhich is better than the random:1 §cRatio§f that you have now.

Also for some stupid reason u have to smelt up the cobblestone with your precious coal ore to get stone that is required for the mortar.

Note: The mortar can be crafted up with a verity of materials, so make sure to check out NEI or JEI or whatever the block inventory I installed to this pack is. 
*This is the case with nearly all Gregtech tools not just the mortar

Aww your mortar already broke after handling about 32 items?

Well, you are in luck, because thier is a special refined version of iron that has 1.5x the normal durabilty of iron Gregtech tools

This refined iron is called: §8Wrought Iron§f

Wrought Iron can be made by resmelting iron bars(Ingots) or nuggets(If you like waiting[Hey maybe u should head to disney during peak hours than!]).

*Regualar Gregtech CEU does not include the ingot to ingot recipe just the nugget to nugget, so I am saving you some time and fuel, you are welcome (:

Yes, tools are actually needed for progression, now before you whine listen up.

The §bhammer §fcan be used to §mpound your mom§f pound through items and resouces, especially §f§mexpensive household items§f metels and ingots. The hammer can easily be crafted up with 1 stick and 6 ingots of many types (Remember to check JEI).

The §9§3§bwrench §fcan be used to create pipes §mfor drug usage§f, and can also be used to rotate pipes and configure thier directions, and toggle pipe input/outputs. This will require the hammer from before and 6 ingots of a metel. More info on the wrench+hammer will be explained later

As of right now these are all of the tools that need to be crafted up at the moment + the mortar from eairlier, but this is not the end of the gregtech tools, they will strike back soon enough. Also, you can repair these tools in an anvil if you are gutsy enough to make one.

No really! They are!

With a Gregtech tier axe, you can take out an entire tree base with one log. I am not joking you, the rumors are true, this pack does have veinminer (But just for trees as of right now).

Go and craft up a gregtech axe if you want a faster way to mine down wood, I will even give you 4 spruce sapling to give you a huge boost in log production.

-Sadly ): the axe is going to require a little more info for crafting it. U will need to craft up a file which require 2 plates of a metel. What is a plate you ask? If you check JEI it is 2 ingots smashed together with the hammer u should have crafted by now. Once u have the file u can easily craft yourself an axe which requires 2 plates and 1 ingot to craft up

Yes! Your coal can be even more usefull in Gregtech!

Coal can be better by §mcrafting up more coal§f creating youself a coke oven

What is a coke oven you ask? the coke oven is a multiblock machine that transfers coal into coal coke, or turns logs into charcoal(if that is your mojo), the coke oven creates a byproduct of §mcoka-cola§f creosote that can be §k§m§f§mdrunkin for a refreshing taste§f used as an early game source of fuel. Fuel is not too much of a big worry now, but later on in the pack, u will understand how important fuel really is.

Checkbox this quest when you are ready to get crafting on your first §mcoka cola factory§m§f multiblock.

To even get started on the coke oven, you will need to have at least some sand-ity! Ha-ha. Oh come on, I was being very clay-full with my words! Ha-ha, alr I will stop.

But seriously you will need a ton of clay and sand, and that is no joke, hopefully you have gathered up some diamonds by now, because a diamond hammer is going to be your fastest means of gathering up sand, and clay at this moment.

Oh yea §7§1§9§bClay, §fClay can be gathered up using a barrel and water. §cYOU WILL NEED A GOOD SOURCE OF WATER BEFOREHAND. THE PWP WILL DO NICELY

§fYou already know how to get sand, but to get clay you need to hammer down sand to dust, than fill a barrel up with some water and place the dust inside to create clay.
clay balls can be collected by breaking the clay block.

You also will need a knife, but I will give this one as a freebie, you are welcome (:

I am thirsty though, and I will reward u if you do give me some water.

I actually lied about the other multiblock, this will actually be your first multiblock you have to make. (Unless u want to use leaves and crucibles for water sources), this multiblock will create an infinite amount of water at a 'fnite rate of what i belive is 250mb/s or 1/4 a bucket per second.

This multiblock is going to require quite a bit of iron and wood so I hope you are prepared.

Check this quest when you are ready to get crafting.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Man I am thirsty, can you fetch me up some water please?

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Collect all these items for the primitve water pump. This is going to be a pain.. but this is gregtech + I am trying to make this pack less grindy for you! 

Just please don't whine and gather up the required materials for the multiblock, it will be worth it

Note: §onothing gurantees this will be worth it

yay the pump is now gated and dam near impossible to craft, gotta love Gregtech!

Since I am not requiring you to make a coke oven beforehand, I will make a little trade offer once again, in this case If you give me 64 planks of any type. I will give you 64 treated wood planks to actually make this multiblock craftable.

Sorry for the inconvience, Chris the questbook guy is not responsible for refunds

"You hear that, you get what you get!" -Probably Chris

You actually DO need another tool to pregress in this age of the modpack, my oopsies ):

This tool is called the §a§a§ascrewdriver§f, and it can §mscrew anyone it wants to§f create blocks for multiblocks, adjust imputs and outputs for barrels, and screw things together duh..

Crafting one of these bad-boys up will require 1 stick and 2 rods of a metel. What is a rod? A rod is a a filed down ingot into, well, a rod!

Also u need to craft up a §asawblade§f, I am really forgetting these tools, wow ): The sawblade is able to cut up rods into bolts, which can be further filed down to get screws. The sawblade can be also used to §mcut up some steak§f pointlessly craft up planks and sticks.

Crafting up a sawblade is going to require 2 plates of a metel and 1 stick.

Finially you have collected all of the resources needed to make up a PWP(Primitive Water Pump), check NEI for a visual to how the multiblock is formed. MAKE SURE THE OUTPUT HATCH IS PONTING DOWN TOWARDS THE GROUND

As promised I will give you a reward for making the PWP, this reward is a §m§f"Insert cool reward name here" , No.. I ment Bronze Fluid Drum. This bad boy can store up to 32 buckets of fluid, which has been collected from your PWP, but first you need pipes to pump the water into the drum, craft up some pipes and I will give you a little tutorial.

oh and, make a soft mallet for crafting the pipes, this can be made like the metel hammer but with wood planks instead, sorry about the late mention..

To use GTCEU pipes they can be placed down in the world as any typical block, now you may have noticed that these pipes dont always connect to eachother.

To get the pipes to connect u will need a §6wrench§f and with the wrench a 3x3 overlay shoud appear as seen below:

x uuu x          
o xxx o
o xxx o
o xxx o
x uuu x

The Middle x's will put the pipes connection towards you

The o's will rotate, connect the machines/pipes on the side of the o accordingly.

The u's will do the same as the o's but up/down

The corner x's will connect the one side that you are not able to do with the other 5. 

I know this is confusing, but will make sense once you play around with it for a little-while, I will even give you a free wrench to play around with
betterquesting:10.name:8: How to use GTCEU pipes for starters(Or N00bs)

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Im too lazy to write the numbers again so I will not write them again, just look on the right side to see the requirements for the coke oven.

A Steam forge hammer will help alot towards buliding this multiblock, so making one beforehand would not be the worst idea in the world.

Thats it for this quest.

Just craft up the controller and build the multiblock in the world (Use JEI if you get stuck).

Hopefully you still have your sanity after crafting this coke structure up.

Luckily I will be giving you a pretty hefty reward for making this whole structure. You are very welcome.

Wait what you can mix metels to get premium metels, no wayyyy.

Actually yes way, and you need to do so to progress, so get alloying away.

The first alloy that you will need to create at this stage is §6bronze, §fthis can be made by crushing 3 ingots of copper, and 1 ingot of tin with your §mmacerator§f motar and combining those 4 dusts in a crafting table(Or your 2x2 crafting grid). This will yield 3 §6bronze §fbut a better §cRatio §fis soon to come.

Bricks, we all love them, and you need them so... make some! Don't look at the questbook like that.. You need them to start the new age, trust me on that one.

Oh, to get bricks all you need to do is the same in vanilla where you smelt clay balls to get bricks, than combine 4 bricks to make 1 brick block.

You will need quite a bit of brick blocks for the near future so crafting up a good amount wouldn't be the worst idea in the world.

Your coal/fuel sources. 

This machine is your first towards the new age, THE §7STEAM §fAGE! With steam you can actually let steam power do the work for you, so you can play more of the pack to eventually play less of the pack, simular to idle games.
Except, you won't...This is Gregtech, thier is always something to do when its Gregtech.

Also for every 4 hours of labor in Gregtech you get a free paid 15 minute break. Gregtech CEO is legally responsible to tell you this information.

Just like humans the boiler also gets thirsty as well.

This means that you are going to want to connect a water source to your boiler, this can either be done straight from the PWP to your boiler

OR

This can be done straight from the bronze drum (Water buffer) to the bronze boiler you will need to use a screwdriver on the bottom side of the drum. It's also recommended to connect the fluid pipe to the bottom of the boiler to keep the other sides of the boiler free for steam purposes.

This boiler accepts SOLID fuels, so make sure you have a decent source of fuel by now

-I would highly reccomend batch crafting a ton of coal ore

OR

-I would highly recommend making a 3x3+ Sieve grid of flint meshes to gather refined coal more effeciently.

OR

-U can do nothing at let your solid boiler run out of fuel, but that will make me sad ):

I mean you could cramp up your chests witha bunch of logs, planks, and ores if you really want to.

Or you can do the next best thing and use storage drawers to store a large amount of a single item (This is the same thing that was used to collect the cobblstone at the beginning of the pack.

Eventually you will have better storage options, but for now this is all you got, just got to grind for a few more §myears§f hours.
betterquesting:10.name:8: A place for all of your ores/wood

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Please do not do this, as you will still need a few flint meshes to gather up coal or as iron+Diamond does not drop coal with gravel ):

I would reccomend that you make a 3x3+ formation of sieves for both flint AND diamond meshes to have the best results for outcomes.

Eventually you will be able to process ore blocks to gather up more resorces from one crude ore, but that will be later on, with full proccessing unlocked with §eHV§f-tier machinery.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Don't Convert All your meshes to Diamond!

betterquesting:10.desc:8: No Description

You could just connect a steam machine right next to the boiler, but you only have a limited number of spots to do so. 

Alternativly you can craft up fluid pipes (Pipes that can handle over 373K worth of heat that is). Wooden fluid pipes are not good enough as they cannot withstand the heat of steam.

Right now thier are a few options for fluid transport, check the information quest to learn more.

For now you should craft up 4 small steam pipes to flow steam to your first steam machinery.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Where is the steam supposed to be flowin?

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Thier are a verity of pipes that you can be using at your stage of tech. The Pipes can be seen as follows:

Also fluid is written as §aLiters§f where §a1000 Liters§f is equivilent to §c1 bucket§f.

Thier is also §a20 ticks per second§f in a minecraft world

So a fluid output of §910L/t (Liters/Tick) §fwould equate to §e200 L/s (Liters/Second) §for §c1/5 of a bucket per second§f.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Which pipe is the best? Help me Chris the Questbookguy!

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The most worthless of pipes

The §d§7§6Copper Fluid Pipe§f is a good start for minimal steam production

§6§7§6Copper Fluid Pipes §fhave a heat tolerance of §c1696K§f

The pipes outputs can be seen as below:

§6§7§6Tiny:§6 §b6L/t §f*The same as 1 §6bronze §fsolid fuel boiler 
§e§e§a§b§c§6Small: §b12L/t §f*The same as 1 §6bronze §fliquid fuel boiler
§6Regular: §b36L/§6§bt §f*The same as 2 §6§8Steel HP §f§fsolar boiler
§6Large: §b72L/t §f*The same as 4 §6§8Steel HP §f§fsolar boiler
§6Huge: §b144L/t §f*The same as 8 §6§8Steel HP §f§fsolar boiler

The most simple of pipes..

The §d§7Wooden Fluid Pipe§f is a good start for simple water transport, make larger pipes as needed.

§6§7Wooden Fluid Pipes §fhave a heat tolerance of §c330K§f

The pipes outputs can be seen as below:

§6Small: §b10L/t §f§6
Regular: §b30L/t §f*Enough to handle output up to 2 PWP's§6
Large: §9§b60L/t §f*Enough to handle output up to 4 PWP's§6 §f(Almost 5 but a few L/t short)
betterquesting:10.name:8: NOT FOR STEAM: Wood Fluid Pipe

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
If you need more water output for whatever reason these are the goto pipes. They offer §6§52x§f the output than regualar wood pipes

The §d§7Treated Wooden Fluid Pipe§f is a good start for intense water transport, make larger pipes as needed.

§6§7Treated Wooden Fluid Pipes §fhave the same heat tolerance of §c330K§f

The pipes outputs can be seen as below:

§6Small: §b20L/t §f§6§f*Enough to handle output up to 1 PWP§6
Regular: §b60L/t §f*Enough to handle output up to 4 PWP's§6§6 §f
§6Large: §9§b120L/t §f*Enough to handle output up to 9 PWP's§6
betterquesting:10.name:8: NOT FOR STEAM: Treated Wood Fluid Pipe

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
The almost most worthless of pipes

The §d§7§6§5Lead Fluid Pipe§f is a good start for minimal steam production

§6§7§6§5Lead Fluid Pipes §fhave a heat tolerance of §c1200K§f

The pipes outputs can be seen as below:

§6§7§6Tiny:§6 §b8L/t §f*More than 1 §6bronze §fsolid fuel boiler 
§e§e§a§b§c§6Small: §b16L/t §f*More than 1 §6§8Steel HP §fsolid fuel boiler
§6Regular: §b48L/§6§bt §f*The same as 4 §6§8§6Bronze §f§fliquid fuel boiler
§6Large: §b96L/t §f*Almost 1/8 of §6Large Bronze Boiler
§6Huge: §b192L/t §f*Almost 1/4 of §6Large Bronze Boiler

Probably the biggest pain for the smallest returns §cRATIO §fthese pipes aren't bad they just aren't the best either

The §d§7§6§5§7Tin Alloy Fluid Pipe§f is a good start for typical steam production

§6§7§6§5§7Tin Alloy Fluid Pipe§f §fhave a heat tolerance of §c1572K§f

The pipes outputs can be seen as below:

§6§7§6Tiny:§6 §b20L/t §f*More than 3x §6§8§6Bronze §fsolar boiler 
§e§e§a§b§c§6Small: §b40L/t §f*More than 2x §6§8Steel HP §fsolar boiler
§6Regular: §b120L/§6§bt §f*More than 1/8 of §6Large Bronze Boiler
§6Large: §b240L/t §f*More than 1/4 of §6Large Bronze Boiler
§6Huge: §b480L/t §f*More than 1/2 of §6Large Bronze Boiler

These pipes are just straight on hard to come by for early game, Gold is not so easy to get

The §d§7§6§5§7§f§eGold Fluid Pipe§f is a good start for typical steam production

§6§7§6§5§7§6§eGold Fluid Pipe§f §fhave a heat tolerance of §c1671K§f

The pipes outputs can be seen as below:

§6§7§6Tiny:§6 §b25L/t §f*More than 2x §6§8§6Bronze §fliquid fuel boiler 
§e§e§a§b§c§6Small: §b50L/t §f*More than 4x §6§8§6Bronze §fliquid fuel boiler
§6Regular: §b150L/§6§bt §f*Same as 3/16 of §6Large Bronze Boiler
§6Large: §b300L/t §f*Same as 3/8 §6Large Bronze Boiler
§6Huge: §b600L/t §f*Same as 3/4 of §6Large Bronze Boiler

Probably the best option for pipes if you are too lazy to make potin, or don't have production of gold or lead(Which you really should now as potin is superior), this also has the same output as Tin Alloy but like way easier to make

The §d§7§6§5§7§6Bronze Fluid Pipe§f is a good start for the most ideal steam production

§6§7§6§5§7§6Bronze Fluid Pipe§f §fhave a heat tolerance of §c1696K§f

The pipes outputs can be seen as below:

§6§7§6Tiny:§6 §b20L/t §f*More than 3x §6§8§6Bronze §fsolar boiler 
§e§e§a§b§c§6Small: §b40L/t §f*More than 2x §6§8Steel HP §fsolar boiler
§6Regular: §b120L/§6§bt §f*More than 1/8 of §6Large Bronze Boiler
§6Large: §b240L/t §f*More than 1/4 of §6Large Bronze Boiler
§6Huge: §b480L/t §f*More than 1/2 of §6Large Bronze Boiler

The best pipe option for now! Potin is not too hard to craft and has the most rewarding returns!

The §d§7§6§5§7§6§dPotin Fluid Pipe§f is a good start for the most ideal steam production

§6§7§6§5§7§6§dPotin Fluid Pipe§f §fhave a heat tolerance of §c1456K§f

The pipes outputs can be seen as below:

§6§7§6Tiny:§6 §b32L/t §f*More than 1x §6§8§6§8Steel Hp §fliquid fuel boiler 
§e§e§a§b§c§6Small: §b64L/t §f*More than 4x §6§8Steel HP §fsolid fuel boiler
§6Regular: §b192L/§6§bt §f*More than 10x §6§8Steel HP §fsolar boiler
§6Large: §b384L/t §f*A little less than 1/2 of §6Large Bronze Boiler
§6Huge: §b768L/t §f*A little less than a §6Large Bronze Boiler

Ya.... These puns will not die off, my badddd

Anyways you can transmute items to create crude lead ore, this can be crafted up by 1x §6bronze §fingot. 4x §9§1lapis §fpieces and 4x §eGold §fore pieces.

Putting all these together will yield §c24x §dLead Ore§f!
betterquesting:10.name:8: Are you leady for the next ore?

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Another Alloy! Let's gooo.

This alloy is called§d Potin§f, Potin is mostly used for making more effecient pipes, and making a steam multiblock that will probably be made soon enough.

For now you are probably going to want to make a 1/2 stack of this stuff to get going on some pipes, potin makes the best pipes for the moment.

This alloy can be made by combining the dusts of 6x §6Bronze §f, 2x §7Tin, §f1x §5Lead §fthis will all yield §c9x §f§dPotin §fdust!

The Steam Forge Hammer is a quite expensive steam machine, but this machine is incredible towards buffing your bronze/metal to plate §cRatio§f. 

Instead of wasting the durablity of your hammer you can now waste the durability of this neverbreaking machine(Unless u mine it with a pickaxe or let it explode). 

The Forge Hammer can also quickly break down cobble to gravel and gravel down to sand, so maybe making the coke oven is not so bad of idea + the coke oven will yield charcoal from logs and improve coal, the creosote will also come in use later on as well! Heck maybe even make a second coke oven if your gutsy.

Also as a quick note when the recipe says §aEu/t §fat this point of age §b2L §fof steam equals §a1Eu§f. so a §a10Eu/t §frecipe would cost §b20L/t §fof steam.

Ima call this machine the §nHydraulic Press
betterquesting:10.name:8: Probably the best Steam Machine out there

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
From now till the end of the modpack you are going to most likely make hulls/shells for all of the machines that you are crafting up.

This quest is just here to leave that message out for you.

Look don't get so scared yet. Hulls are somewhat cheap to make. For example, the §6bronze §fmachine hull only requires 8 §6bronze §fplates which at the moment costs 16 ingots, but after creating the next machine in the upcoming quest, all hulls on are going to only cost 12 §6bronze §fingots. Eventually that number will go down to 8 §6bronze §fingots for 1 §6bronze §fhull. 

What I mean to say is that, the §cRatios §fwill suck at first, but the more you push through the better it is going to get in the long run.

Easy!

U need
8x compressed cobble
1x§6 bronze §fingot
1/4 tsp salt
3/4 cups brown sugar
6 cups apples sliced(Granny or Honeycrisp)
2 cups flour
1 tbsp lemon juice
1 pie crust
3/4 tsp cinnamon

than you can make yourself some good redstone-apple pie

Haha alr I will stop.

But you will need to make some pistons along the way for some of these Gregtech machines.

Also sorry about the small quest sizes, but they just fit so perfectly as a little trio on top of the forge hammer quests.

You will also need a anvil as well, they aint cheap so make sure you got a good way of prouducing iron

Anyways, happy crafting (:
betterquesting:10.name:8: Ok, these mini quests are pis-tin me off!

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
I mean whatever floats your boat...

You could just spam this machine, but your coal supply is really going to suffer from this, although this may be feasable up to about 4 boilers, than I would get upgrading(Once you have better metels) or using a steam boiler that doesn't require depleating your coal supply. 

A §6Bronze §9Solid Fuel Boiler §fhas the ability to produce §9§b120L a second §for §b6L/t §for §a3eu/t §fwhich will not be enough to keep the §6bronze §falloy smelter continously operated, this smelter typically uses §a8eu/t§f(Despite it saying 16eu/t this is reduced to 8eu/t due to processing speed of bronze machines) §e§fduring the worst steam recipies.

You will soon learn the difference between §8High Pressure §fSteam machines and §6bronze §fsteam machines.

And no don't be a smart-a$$ you cannot use steam as fuel to make more steam. That would be OP

This machine burns through oil quite quickly, but is the most rapid way of collecting steam. Using the excess §ecreosote §ffrom your coke oven would be a great way to produce a punch more steam for your machines

A §6Bronze §9Liquid Fuel Boiler §fis double as fast as the solid counterpart and §fhas the ability to produce §9§b240L a second §for §b12L/t §for §a6eu/t §fwhich will not be enough to keep the §6bronze §falloy smelter continously operated, this smelter typically uses §a8eu/t§f(Despite it saying 16eu/t this is reduced to 8eu/t due to processing speed of bronze machines) §e§fduring the worst steam recipies.

You will soon learn the difference between §8High Pressure §fSteam machines and §6bronze §fsteam machines.

Yes, this is true, the sun can be enough to produce steam, but you still need a water source.

This machine uses the energy of the sun to create steam, so this is a maitnance-free way of generate steam free of fuel sources. Silver will also be collectable once you get yourself an alloy smelter §n§n§o§n§f§n§f§oJust Make sure it is daytime§f

A §6Bronze §9Solar Boiler §fis the same speed as the solid counterpart and §fhas the ability to produce §9§b120L a second §for §b6L/t §for §a3eu/t §fwhich will not be enough to keep the §6bronze §falloy smelter continously operated, this smelter typically uses §a8eu/t§f(Despite it saying 16eu/t this is reduced to 8eu/t due to processing speed of bronze machines) §e§fduring the worst steam recipies.

You will soon learn the difference between §8High Pressure §fSteam machines and §6bronze §fsteam machines.

This is an excellent place to dump all of the extra stupid §ecreosote §fthat you do not want

This machine burns through oil quite quickly, but is the most rapid way of collecting steam. Using the excess §ecreosote §ffrom your coke oven would be a great way to produce a punch more steam for your machines, this is also the fastest steam-producing singleblock boiler in the game.

A §6§8High Pressure §9Liquid Fuel Boiler §fis double as fast as the solid counterpart and §fhas the ability to produce §9§b600L a second §for §b30L/t §for §a15eu/t §fwhich is more than enough to keep the §6bronze §falloy smelter continously operated, this smelter typically uses §a8eu/t§f(Despite it saying 16eu/t this is reduced to 8eu/t due to processing speed of bronze machines) §e§fduring the worst steam recipies.

This will almost be enough to keep the §8High Pressure §falloy smelter continously operated, as this smelter usually uses §a16eu/t.

No Im not. 

The §6Steam Oven §fis a crazy multiblock that has the ability to smelt up to 8 items at a time using normal furnace times(10 sec/item) except you are doing 8 items instead of one.

This is not the cheapest recipe in the world to craft up so, I will make a little deal... Since bronze plates and materials are quite expensive at your age, I will reduce the grind quite a bit. If you build roughly half of the requirements for the machine, I will give you the other half for free. -One coupon per customer limit. 

To get started, craft up the controller for the multiblock, the §6Steam Oven. §fYou will need 36x§6 Bronze §fIngot

Solar Power Op! The sun is just that good this is crazy!

This machine is so powerful that the sun just is that much better than the orginal solar boiler, so good that the boiler is 3x as effective. This is also the most practical, and argubly the best singleblock steam boiler in the game as no fuel is required except for the overbearing sun above.

A §6§8High Pressure §9Solar Boiler §fis the 3x as fast as the §6bronze §fcounterpart and §fhas the ability to produce §9§b360L a second §for §b18L/t §for §a9eu/t §fwhich will not be enough to keep the §6bronze §falloy smelter continously operated, this smelter typically uses §a8eu/t§f(Despite it saying 16eu/t this is reduced to 8eu/t due to processing speed of bronze machines) §e§fduring the worst steam recipies.

This will also not be enough  to keep the §8High Pressure §falloy smelter continously operated, as this smelter usually uses §a16eu/t. §f§a§9§7§4§5§3(Try 2 of these bad boys next time)

You used it all....

Oh well, at least thier are better means of producing steam, especially with multiblocks, but that is later.

Right now 1 §6Bronze §9Solid Boiler §fis not going to cut it, well I have 3 options for you at the moment!

The other 2 are gated until you achive some §bglass§f which is a process and a half to collect, Sorry ):
betterquesting:10.name:8: Hey Where did all my steam go?

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Yea throw that dumb a$$ mortar away! You don't need that stupid crap anymore.

With the macerator you can §mGrind up pork to make sausage§f crush items to recive precious dusts from them.

The macerator can also improve §cRatios §fof crushing things. This can include Brick blocks, and clay. 

The macerator has also one amazing abilty. It can double ores! Yea that is right, it can DOUBLE ores. Thier is a catch though ): It is super slow at this level of tech, and u do not recive any byproducts, just the plain old ore. That is alr for now though as I am sure you want to be doubling your ores to reduce the grind for them.

More info on Ore-Doubling on daughter quest. 

Ima call this machine §nThe Macerator§f, very creative.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Macerator! Is that what this guy was talking about? The better mortar?

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
yay now you can compress your 1Tb photo of cats to a .rar so you can post it on the internet.

The steam compressor is nothing special on its own, but is required for advancing in the pack. 

The steam compressor can craft a verity of thigs such as wood planks(Not the ones you think), compress certain materials such as fireclay(You will learn about this soon enough), and can compress files.

I will call this machine §nWinRar

Wow you have finially made the forge hammer! Good Job.

Now lets put this machine into motion.

Just put in 3 §6bronze §fingots and be happy that your §cRatio §fhas improved!

I am so proud of you (:

Now just make the other 49817241094 singleblocks that are needed to progress.

Ya alloys are not going to go away anytime soon. In fact after doing this quest, thier is a brand new alloy that you can make, but I will leave that to the other quest to explain.

What matters now is that you are crafting up bronze but only yield 3 dust per 4 dust combined which is a stupid §cRatio §fluckily with a little(lot) a bit of steam power you can outsmart the §cRatio§f and get a 1:1 §cRatio§f with dusts used to dusts recived. The alloy smelter is so powerful §mit sawed this boat in half§f it doesn't even need dusts to combien metels, this means that you can put 3 copper ingots and 1 tin ingot and the smelter will happily work with its imputs, no need to waste durability on your motar.

Oh and make sure you have a decent source of steam generation, this machine is power hungry "Yum, Yum, STEAM" -Metal Combiner 10

I am going to call this machine §nMetal Combiner 10

We are at it again... >:

Oh well, just make the alloy, you will be able to recive a new valuable ore if you do so!

Haha now you are listening. I am serious though, make some tin alloy and you can get yourself some §7Silver.

§fHow do I get §7Silver§ , You ask? §7Silver §fcan be smelted out of tin-alloy because that obviously makes the most sense and is not 100% trying to be gated to make you required to craft the alloy smelter, why you ask?

Yea but just smelt a tin-alloy ingot and you will recive 1 §7Silver §fIngot in return, better sources of this ore are soon to come.

Anotha alloy bites the dust.

This alloy is needed to craft the ultimate steam oven!

I would reccomend crafting up that multiblock as the multiblock is really useful towards smelting batch quantanties at once.

First you need to create some §2Invar§f. §2Invar §falloy can be created by using your alloy smelter(metal combiner 10), with 1x §9nickel §fand 2x §7Iron §fto output 3x §2Invar§f

Go try it out!

yes, yes I know you are excited 2x the ore, that is amazing.

But what if I told you that this is not a 1 step process.

Yea thats right it's not, its actually a multi-step process that increases as your tech improves.

Ores get smashed down as follows: 
Ore Block --> Crushed Ore --> Impure Dust --> Pure Dust

For Now I would use the macerator to crush the ore block to the crushed ore and than I would use the forge hammer to crush the crushed ore to get the dust from it. The macerator would take forever + you don't get any byproducts from it yet so try to be effective with your time. 

Lets do some practice with some Copper ore!
betterquesting:10.name:8: Prepare for trouble, and make it DOUBLE

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Your ore is dirty because your mind is dirty!

Naaa, just kidding, your ore is dirty because it has not been refined yet. Since thier is no 'Steam Ore Cleaner' you cannot use a singleblock machine to clean your ores(Except you can, but not at this age of tech). 

For now you are going to have to use the latest innovation! The Cauldren! Now I know this is not much, but it is the best we have to deal with. Just fill the cauldrun up with water and drop as much impure dust as you can(Works up to a stack[u can drop stacks at a time]). The cauldren will use up some water to §mmoisterize§f clean the dust. This can be done up to 3 times before needing a refill.

Enjoy your newly doubled resources!

Now this machine, while not required I would reccomend(Unless you like wasting your coal when you can avoid doing so). 

The steam furnace is not fast at all[takes about 13sec to smelt 1 item], but is a start to using (almost) free fuel.

While this does take longer than a normal furnace, this is not the main goal of this machine, infact this machine can make a quite powerfull multiblock that smelts 8 items in 10 seconds!

That would mean that you would yield 1 item every 1.25 seconds, which is way better than spamming furnaces.

For now you can use the pathetic 13s smelt time though.

While this machine is not currently needed at the moment, this machine will be used to gather up your first rubber.

Do not worry about rubber for now, I would just focus on working on other machines at the moment, thier are many machines that you can make right now if you have not already + you need glass which you cannot get yet, so another downfall thier.

Anyways Ima call this machine the §nPuller§e§f, very creative, pulls items from other items. 

You will eventually have to do this quest though, just don't sweat it for now, wait till you advance to AGE 2 first.

Not againnnnnn

This time you will need to create a multiblock called the: Bricked Blast Furnace, I know sounds complex, but it really isn't. The BBF is your source for a new material called §8Steel , Steel §fcan be used to upgrade bronze machines, and can be used to make entry-level electronics, but more on that later.

For now you are going to need steel to make an extracter to gather up some §erubber.

§fThis is quite an expensive multiblock, so get your thinking cap on, and lets get started. 

The requirements may look weird, but you will need 33 clay blocks, and half of those pieces of clay from the blocks(66 pieces) will need to get smelted into bricks.

This is what is required apparently...

So annoying...

To make the §4fireclay §fdust, you are going to need to macerate down the clay and the bricks all the way down to dusts.

You "Could" use your mortar, but than you will need 4x as much materials which is really not worth the extra effort. The macerator is slow, so while you are waiting, you can probably get working on one the steam tier multiblocks, Grinder or Oven, as this will make your life so much eaiser thier on.

Also, to put more insult to your injury, all of the §4fireclay §fdust needs to get compressed down to §4firebrick §fbars.

Oh and, you are still not done after that ): Im Sorry..

*Note: this quest only requires 20 to complete, but you still need to make 132 bars, I just don't want you wasting time collecting all of them just to process them even farther innefficently.

The problem here is that §F§4Firebricks §fare too large in thier uncompressed file format. Uncompressed §4Firebricks §fuse the .png file-type which is quite ineffiecent. 

Luckily, you can use your compressor(WinRar) to reduce the file size of the §4Firebricks, §fwhich should have been done already.

To fix the file size, you need to burn the firebricks to a disc. This can be done by putting §4compressed fireclay §fin a furnace

"Splishy, Splooshy, Smashy, Smooshy!" - Probably that stupid Questbook guy

Pls hand them over, I will give you what you need for the next quest, just give me those premium §4Firebrick.zip §ffiles, I really need them.

Pleassssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssssse
betterquesting:10.name:8: Ima actually need those firebrick.zip files pls... I need them for research purposes..

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
This experiment is nearing its conclusion (Def not portal reference).

This is the part where you actually get to build the multiblock! Good for you! 

As a reward, I will be giving you a second BBF for free!

Also check JEI for instructions on how to build the multiblock, this can be found by clicking on the Primitive Blast furnace block in JEI.

*Note: Some Gregtech multiblocks can share walls with eachother, this means that you can have two BBF share the walls with each other resulting in less resources used for another one, you can actually make a 2x2 BBF array with each consecutive furance being cheaper than the last one. Two should be enough to suffice for now though.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Finishing up the BBF! Awwww yee!

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Nice work, with your 2 BBF you should be a master at producing §8Steel §fnow! Wait... u don't have §8Steel§f?

Alr, let me tell you how to gather up steel than...

You will need either 2x charcoal, 2x coal, or 1x coal coke(This is why coke oven is awesome), 

You have two ingots u can melt for §8Steel

§f§7Iron§f which can be paired with coal or charcoal for a rate of §690 §6sec/ingot§6§f or if you use coal coke §675 sec/ingot

§f§7Wrought Iron, §fwhich isn't that much harder to come by can by paired with coal or charcoal for a rate of §640 sec/ingot §for if used with coal coke §630 sec/ingot

§fYou can also use blocks of fuels/resources but that takes alot of waiting, and you tend to use ingots more.
betterquesting:10.name:8: I got the multiblock up. Now what?

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Yay, you made the required amount of §8Steel §fto progress!

You can now official say that you made it to Age-2 of this pack!

This is where things start to get a little complex though, as some preliminary electronics are going to have a start. In this age you will eventually move from steam power to electric power.

Don't worry though, it is going to be a fun little journey though. 

So buckle up, because we are ready to go.

Also, I would still reccomend you make at least 1 of those steam multiblocks, they will make resource synthesis so much eaiser.

Grind up these materials and I will give you the other half for free *No Refunds

This is one heck of a grind, but I promise the reward of creating this machine will be worth it, you will be able to crush more ores onwards much faster!

THIS WILL COST §c94x §6Bronze! §e§fWhich is still insane, orginally this would cost you §c151x §6Bronze §f+ §c27 §ffrom the controller, so a total of §c178x §6Bronze. §fBe greatfull, alright. This is the last time I will do something like this.

Oh and make sure you do not accidently make an output bus!

Sucess, Sucess, Sucess!

Now to see if you can actually get this thing running.

Typically this multiblock uses around §a5eu/t §fwhich means that u can use either 2x §6bronze §fsolar/solid fuel boiler, if you are poor, OR you can use just 1x any of the §8high pressure §fboilers, and they should be more than enough to keep this machine continously running, (Make sure the boilers are at full heat before saying I am wrong[Spoiler: I am not wrong]).

With that aside, Go and smelt up some copper or something. I would do copper as this resource is needed the most right now. You will have a full stack smelted in §980 seconds! §fOr §91 min 20 seconds §fif your anal about time.

Have a free stack of copper to show off your new multiblock.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Testing out your brand spankin new oven!

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
I would most likely be dead beacause someone will get so mad at me they would go the lengths to kill me. I would probably die from a pun-ch! Haha ya, Im going to get assassinated.

Ok well on the good-term that I am still alive and able to expand upon this modpack, You will need to gather up some silver for some more alloys that will be used in the future. You will want to gather this ore, the rewards from making the alloy, for another thing will be worth it(No Spoilers Yet).

To gather up some §bNickel §fyou are going to need 8 pieces of double compressed cobble + 1 iron block. This is quite expensive, but is also balanced. You will yield §c32x §bNickel §fOre from crafting it up.
betterquesting:10.name:8: If I had a nickel everytime I made a pun.

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Grind up these materials and I will give you the other half for free *No Refunds

This is one heck of a grind, but I promise the reward of creating this machine will be worth it, you will be able to smelt more ores onwards much faster!

This also can be used as a primitve Multi-smelter which is a much, much later multiblock that will replace this multiblock, but don't worry about that right now.

THIS WILL COST §c86x §6Bronze! §e§fWhich is still insane, orginally this would cost you §c144x §6Bronze §f+ §c36 §ffrom the controller, so a total of §c180x §6Bronze. §fBe greatfull, alright. This may be the last time I will do something like this.

Oh and make sure you do not accidently make an output bus!

This steam machine is so useless that I didn't even bother to change the quest name or to make the quest look normal in the questing tree.

If you want to make this machine, than go ahead...

I really do not reccomend it though. This machine also requires quite a setup and lava, and honestly, it is just not worth the effort of doing so.

The quest reward is probably better than this machine anyways..

you are going to need them. Actually, you are going to need alot of them, this is the case with pratically everthing in Gregtech.

I know you have been waiting so patiently for glass synthesis, so I will tell you how to resolve this lack of glass problem.

First you need to craft yourself up a steel mold, and form it to a block mold, the final result can be found on the final task of this quest.

Also don't place down the glass and expect to get the drop when you break it, because you won't. Just like vinilla glass does not drop itself when broken(by fist).

Now you can finally see through blocks, but only glass.

Or, you know you can actually craft up some nice machinery, like the solar boiler(Incredible idea, you should really do this one), or you can craft up the extractor that you keep putting off to craft for some reason. You can also make glass panes the most op blocks in the game as you don't have to be in creative more to place this block, all other blocks require creative mode to place, quit hacking!

*BONK*

/\/\/\/\/\/\/\

I think this questbookguy has a few screws loose, he doesn't even know what he is talking about, I will take it from here till the end of this quest. 

Glass can be made from combining flint dust + crushed sand(quartz sand dust). Slap this dust into an alloy smelter with the mold u just made, and you will get some nice new glass

Please do this as quickly as possible before Chris wakes up!

This is actually a better use of your fuel, now were talking

This boiler more effectivly uses your fuel by producing more steam, all because the machine is made with better materials apparently. I didn't make the pack don't ask me how this works. This boiler is the easiest of the three to make and could be used, but requires maintanace with fuel every now and again

A §6§8High Pressure §9Solid Fuel Boiler §fhas the ability to produce §9§b300L a second §for §b15L/t §for §a7.5eu/t §fwhich will almost be enough to keep the §6bronze §falloy smelter continously operated, this smelter typically uses §a8eu/t§f(Despite it saying 16eu/t this is reduced to 8eu/t due to processing speed of bronze machines) §e§fduring the worst steam recipies.

This will also not be enough to keep the §8High Pressure §falloy smelter continously operated, as this smelter usually uses §a16eu/t.

I said! No I am Not!

This machine will save you quite a bit of time when having to deal with ore doubling. 

Unless u want to wait 40 seconds to crush one ore down to crushed ore, I suggest that you make this machine so you can crush down 8 ores in 31 seconds instead.

While this is still not the fastest in the world, this is still a huge improvement towards crude ore processing. 

To start off you will need to craft up the steam grinder controller. And yes I am still doing the you build half I give the other half offer.

This will require §c27x §6bronze

For some multiblocks, you are actually given a HUD of the system information. 

For the two steam multiblocks that you can make, both of them can hold 64k Liters of steam(64 buckets).

Now you may ask, what happens if I don't have enough steam to power my machine? Luckily with the steam machines, you will not loose any inputs and the multiblock will not start until it has enough steam to process whatever material is put in.

This means that the machines will just wait until it has enough steam till it operates, so be patient.

The steam furnace will require §c2000L §fof steam to perform one operation. (This if you are smelting at 5eu/t). 

Now watch your badbay cook up materials super fast!

Cheers! Cheers! Cheers!

Please tell me you know how to build multiblocks with using the blueprints in JEI. pls..

Typically this multiblock uses around §a2eu/t §fwhich means that u can use any §6bronze §fboiler, OR you can use just 1x any of the §8high pressure §fboilers, and they should be wayyy more than enough to keep this machine continously running

With that aside, Go and Grind up some copper ore or something. I would do copper as this resource is being used up quite a bit. You will have a full stack grinded up to crushed ore in §9248 seconds! §fOr §94 min 8 seconds §fif your anal about time. This is much better than the §7§6bronze §fmacerator of time of §92,560sec/stack (42.7 min) §for even the upgraded §8high pressure§f macerator which has the processing time of  §91,280sec/stack (21.4 min) §fwhich also uses more power than the multiblock as well.

Have a free stack of a ore of your choice to show off your new multiblock.

That quest title was totally not stolen from another modpacks name.

Anyways, I feel that it is in my debt to reward you for making two multiblock machines.

Take this reward you really deserve it  (:

Also these are not the only multiblocks you are going to have to craft up, thier are many more multiblocks that you can make later on. These were optional so I am actually happy that you took your time to craft these up.

Than just skip the night..

If you want to go to bed hungry, you can craft up a bed with the string that you have gotten from the 'silk'-infested tree that you have made/harvested.

Nighty Night.

I think it is time for you to be able to craft up coal in a more efficent manner.

To make a better §cRatio §ffor coal, you are going to need the following:

1x §6Bronze Block
§f4x §7Iron Ingot
§f4x Double Copressed Cobble

U will recive §932x §8Coal Ore

§fThis is of course if you are willing to spend all your bronze for this.

Since Wood planks are so sturdy you can actually cheaply craft up more ores with it.

With the low price of some alloying, some copressing for the planks, and a whole lot of cobblestone you can craft up some ores.

For an alternative §7Iron Ore §fcalled §3Banded Iron Ore§f you will need 1x Double Compressed Cobble, 4x §6§7Tin Alloy§f, 4x §2Wood Plank

§fHopefully, this makes gathering ore onwards a little less grindy and more fun.

Since Wood planks are so sturdy you can actually cheaply craft up more ores with it.

With the low price of some alloying, some copressing for the planks, and a whole lot of cobblestone you can craft up some ores.

For an alternative §7§4§6Copper Ore §fcalled §3§3§4Chalcopyrite(I think)§f you will need 1x Double Compressed Cobble, 4x §6§7§6Bronze Ingot§f, 4x §2Wood Plank

§fHopefully, this makes gathering ore onwards a little less grindy and more fun.

In order to do your planks you are going to have to macerate down some logs, either log would work.

This will drop out some wood pulp. This pulp is so good that it can be used to make §mwood-juice§f compressed wood .

Compressed Wood(Wood Planks) can be used §mas a surface to do planks on§f to make ores more effeciently, and to craft up coated circuit boards which will be delt with later in the §1§4§5§2Advanced Steam Age§f.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Time to hit up some planks, Give me 8 sets of 2 minutes

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Since Tin is so simple to aquire, and used kinda commonly, I feel that I should make a simple but a little gated recipe for it.

To gather up 24x Cassiterite(Tin but with 2x ingots per smelt) you will need

4x Tin Ingot
4x Tin alloy ingot
1x Double Compressed Cobble

Making the Bricked Blast furnace can be a real pain.

Luckily I have an option for you to do while you wait for the items of the BBF to be made. (This is of course if you decide to not make the two steam multiblocks or just skipped making them. Or made them already if you are wikid!)

Steam machines can actually be semi automated with the use of hoppers/item pipes and chests.

You can actually create a chain of hoppers as a pipe or you can use an item pipe to pull the results from the steam machines out.

OR if you only want to pull out items from one bronze machine and leave the others manual, you can use 1 hopper to push the items into item pipes which can transfer items at a given rate. §7§7§7Tin Item Pipes§f§f§f would be the most praticle Item pipe to make at the moment.

Or just for people not familiar with Gregtech automation.

ITEM PIPES can only push items and cannot pull items from machines/structures which means that either a hopper will can pull items out or a pump/conveyer belt can pull items out(But that is gated for now). For now hoppers will have to do.

You can adjust item pipes just like fluid pipes with a wrench as well.

Pipes can be connected to storage drawers, so you do not just have to compromise with just a chest for the output, storage drawers work fine and are a great way of showing off your resource collection.

Sometimes it is just better to make a hopper train(Espcially when you have multiple steam machines running side to side, this will be slower than item pipes but can be more practicle in some situations).

2x better in fact.

With a little bit more bronze you can craft yourself a double-chest for the low price of one block, instead of two.

Now you can store all of your §mamoung us memes§n§n§m§n§m§f items for future projects!

Wow! Someone actually downloaded my modpack. I was not expecting this. Thank you for downloading though, I hope you enjoy (:

Oh and, Hi! I am Chris the questbookguy, and I am supposed to get you through the mod GregsNeck? No shoot I misread the script, it Gregtech. 

Ya so um, I will walk you through the mod I guess..

I think I know what I am doing (:

This is your very source of ores for gregtech, since I don't like mining, and I am sure other people do not like mining as well, I will explain what gets what.

PS: It has to deal with cobble generation
betterquesting:10.name:8: What is this crap I just got?

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
To get a tree, I will do a little trade offer for you. But just for this one time...

give me 8 pieces of dirt and I will give you something to grow on that dirt that you collect. That is, if you can steal the dirt back of course (;

Supplies are nice. 

So make them...

yea you should go do that, they will help.

quit reading this and go craft the stuff ight.

u shouldn't have to wait for the tree to grow, I gave you bonemeal.

get yourself a furnace and smelt down those bad boy ores. Since I'm such a nice questbook maker I will even give you a furnace §4FREE AND§o §n§f§k§l§k§f§l§lIt will have some fuel as well with it! §l§l§fyes this is not a joke!
betterquesting:10.name:8: Smelting down these new sexy ores (;

betterquesting:10.desc:8: A little more expensive than the Iron ore counterpart, but still extremly cheap only costing 18 cobblestone from the cobblestone generator. Cassiterite Ore can be crafted with two compressed pieces of cobble on the top right most side. *Check Jei

A little more expensive than the Iron ore counterpart, but still extremly cheap only costing 18 cobblestone from the cobblestone generator. Copper can be crafted with two compressed pieces of cobble on the top left most side. *Check Jei

To get some iron ore, this will be the cheapest recipe of the ores, you will only need 10 pieces of cobblestone for one ore, this piece of compressed cobblestone has to be put on the top left corner and a regular piece of cobblestone to the right of the compressed piece(Use JEI). The recipe is not a shapeless one.

Since this world is supaflat you will need other means to gather gravel,sand, and clay.

Luckily you do have these means via labor and a hammer you are freaking welcome (:

you need to craft up a hammer(Ex Nihilo One, NOT GREGTECH) this will smash up the cobble to bring it down to gravel

u can do this again to go to gravel-->sand than sand-->dust. 

Dust?, Yeah that will be explained later...

Yes, this is correct.. Coal is expensive for some goshdarn reason...I wonder who fault that is, def not the person who made this pack. Oh well... to get a coal ore you need to get 8 wopping pieces of copressed cobblestone and put them in the crafting grid as if you are making a chestplate(Or breastplate if your horny) and boom you will recive your realistically gas priced fuel for your furnace. 

but you have to smelt it first.... luckily smelting 1 coal ore gives 2 coal pieces.
Follow this short quest line to find out an eaiser way to gather coal without eating through all of your cobblestone, instead only taking small bites.
§1§1§1§0§3§5§7§c§fmaking a crook for a tree will make the tree yeild more saplings and also will drop worms which will be key towards better coal §k§k§f§o§c§oRatios

Punching, no I mean, placing a silkworm will make a tree turn white and be filled with what appears to be a white sticky warm fluid. Yes you were thinking correctly. Its string...

now stop thinking sus thoughts and collect the dang string before I make another middle school tier joke.

This ore-proccessing is quite pethetic so I do not recommend using this as a means to gather up ores as the §c§c§cratio§f to cobble to resorces is much better with crafting than it is with sifting. Exept for coal which is just a be-ach.

Anyways craft up 2 sieves and 2 sieve meshs and I will give you another two for free. No scams this time.

By the way, you can put sieves next to each other all the way up to a 5x5 square to sieve all of the blocks at once. Pretty Nifty, Innit.
betterquesting:10.name:8: Sifting for ores. (AKA tier 0 ore proccessing)

betterquesting:10.desc:8:
No, it isn't...

You will need to get some flint and convert your string meshes all the way to flint stiffined meshes. Flint can be gathered by hammering cobble and by repeatingly breaking down flint with a shovel/fist until a piece of flint pops out. OR/OR you can use a mortar if you have crafted one already.

Get §cRATIO'D, §fyou have now beat the system of the §cRATIO§f of cobble to coal. 

Well done..

Since I am a GIGA CHAD, I will give you a few pieces of coal to celebrate your victory.

Oh and, the byproducts from the flint sieve can be used for better§c ratios§f of other ores, so maybe this ore proccesing is not too too bad after all.

Type in chat /bq_admin default load or collect the reward from this quest to update the questbook for future updates(If those ever even come out).

I'm too dumb to get the stupid command to work so for now you are just going to have to do this manually.

Type:  /bq_admin default load   *Pressing tab should autofill

betterquesting:10.desc:8: Starting off with nothing but a stupid person as a questbook narrator, "I know him it's me" -Chris the questbookguy
Starting to get feet wet in Gregtech. This Age deals with the basics of steam power, and advances towards a more powerful resource.
With Steel Aquired, more advanced steam machines can be created, and eventually can get advanced enough to use straight up electrical power with the creation of a new electronic.
